intro: Rinorea passoura, commonly known as the red-flowered rinorea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually ovate and have a smooth, waxy texture. Rinorea passoura is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
